articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Bangladesh
Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Bangladesh 
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let's Give Fuller Play to the Advantages of Our People's Power" was brought out in booklet by the Bangladesh-DPRK Friendship and Solidarity Committee on September 1.
 The work published on December 21, Juche 81 (1992) clarifies the issue of the solidity and vitality of the people's power, the issue of increasing its function and role, the issue of steadfastly maintaining its fundamental principle and the issue of improving and strengthening the work of its organs.

articles.title: U.S. Foreign Policy Is Bound to Ruin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Lauded 
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Korean people will always emerge victorious as they are led by Kim Jong Il. Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, said this in a statement on August 25 on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
 He said that the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung could make dynamic progress and the self-reliant national defence power of the DPRK significantly grow stronger as Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership.   
 Thanks to his Songun revolutionary leadership the Korean people could achieve only victories in the fierce political and military confrontation with the U.S. imperialists, he noted.

articles.content:
Greetings to Brazilian President 
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on September 1 sent a message of greetings to Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva, president of Brazil, on the occasion of its independence day.
 The message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the well-being of the Brazilian people and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kayagum Ensemble
articles.content:
Greetings to PM and FM of Macedonia
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Nikola Guevski upon his appointment as prime minister of the Republic of Macedonia.
 Expressing the belief that the bilateral relations will grow stronger in mutual interests, the message sincerely wished the prime minister fresh success in his responsible work for prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.    
 DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Antonio Milososki upon his appointment as foreign minister of Macedonia.

Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a congratulatory letter by the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 58th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 They were handed to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun by Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, who is doyen of the corps, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Italian Ambassador
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine
   Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was sent to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the 58th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 It was handed to an official concerned by Mohammad Shahta Zarab, Palestinian ambassador e. p. to the DPRK on Wednesday.
